p.s: Description of Gluconobacter cerinus sp. nov., nom. rev.

Gram-negative rods, occurring singly, in pairs or in chains, 0.5-1.0 x 1.0- 2.0 Î¼m. Polarly flagellated when motile. Forms glossy, smooth, and entire colonies. Grows on mannitol agar. Produces gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, and 5-ketogluconate from glucose, dihydroxyacetone from glycerol, and acetic acid from ethanol. Produces neither water-soluble brown pigment on glucose-yeast extract-calcium carbonate nor 2,5-diketogluconate from glucose. Grows mostly on ribitol, xylitol, and L-arabitol. Requires pantothenic acid but not nicotinic acid for growth. DNA base composition ranges from 54.2 to 57.6 mol % guanine plus cytosine. Possesses Q-10 system. Cellular fatty acid is of C18:1 acid type.
Habitats are mainly fruits and flowers.
